text: Maximilien-Charles Simon (8 March 1797 - 20 September 1861) was a French composer. == Life == Simon was born on 19 ventôse of the Vth year (8 March 1797), in Metz, (Moselle).Dossier des Archives nationales, cote LH/2522/74 sur base léonore He studied at the Conservatoire de Paris, where he was a pupil of Gossec, Méhul and Cherubini in composition and Berton in harmony.Notice musimem.com. With the cantata Pyrame et Thisbé, based on a text by J. A. Vinaty,J. A. Vinaty on BNF he won the Second Prix de Rome in 1823, after Édouard Boilly and . But he didn't have a musical career. He became a postal inspector in the department of Seine. In this capacity, he was made a Knight of the Imperial Order of the Legion of Honour by decree of 16 August 1860. The certificate was presented to him on 8 September of the year by State Councillor Auguste Stourm, General Director of the Swiss Post. == References == == External links == Category:French Romantic composers Category:19th- century French composers Category:French male composers Category:Prix de Rome for composition Category:1797 births Category:People from Metz Category:1861 deaths Category:Chevaliers of the Légion d'honneur Category:19th-century male musicians
